content.webTitle: Ravanelli shown the door at Derby

fields.headline: Ravanelli shown the door at Derby
fields.bodyText: Fabrizio Ravanelli has been told he is no longer wanted at relegated Derby. The manager John Gregory said: "I have told [him] to look for another club." But Ravanelli's agent Giovanni Paladini insisted: "Fabrizio has not told me to find him another club and he is happy to play in the First Division... he still has a year left on his contract." Sepp Blatter yesterday criticised a plan to sue him, claiming that he was the victim of a witch hunt designed to destroy his reputation. A case against the Fifa president is expected to be filed in a Zurich court today by 11 members of his executive committee who allege he breached Swiss law by refusing to notify the authorities of illegal practices within the organisation. Manchester City's manager Kevin Keegan is ready to snatch the £3.8m defender Sylvain Distin from under the noses of Newcastle, where the on-loan Frenchman has been unable to agree personal terms. Meanwhile Newcastle have pulled out of a match against a Saudi Arabia XI in Jeddah on July 19 because of the political situation in the Middle East. Lazio have appointed the former Leicester and Italy striker Roberto Mancini as coach in place of Alberto Zaccheroni. Paul Devlin has completed a £200,000 move from Sheffield United to Birmingham. Nearly 200 fans were arrested when hooligans clashed with Dutch riot police after Feyenoord's 3-2 victory over Borussia Dortmund in Wednesday's Uefa Cup final. An Agustin Delgado goal gave Ecuador a 1-0 win over Yugoslavia in New York in an ill-tempered friendly in which three players were sent off. · You've read the piece, now have your say.
